pitrou commented on pull request #3443: ARROW-4297: [C++] Fix build error with MinGW-w64 32-bit
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3443#discussion_r249534043
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/util/sse-util.h
 ##########
 @@ -110,7 +110,12 @@ static inline uint32_t SSE4_crc32_u32(uint32_t crc, uint32_t v) {
 }
 
 static inline uint32_t SSE4_crc32_u64(uint32_t crc, uint64_t v) {
+#if defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__MINGW64__)
+  DCHECK(false) << "MinGW-w64 32-bit doesn't support _mm_crc32_u64()";
 
 Review comment:
   Did you run the tests or are you only concerned about building? This is pretty much not the right solution.

jeroen commented on issue #3443: ARROW-4297: [C++] Fix build error with MinGW-w64 32-bit
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3443#issuecomment-457046597
 
 
   @pitrou your [patch](https://gist.github.com/pitrou/f4282f68a8dc9b11fe931bd0eeb1f8af) will probably work icw/ this PR. But you really need to put the call to `_mm_crc32_u64` behind a macro otherwise it won't compile (even though you're not actually using that function).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

   @pitrou your [patch](https://gist.github.com/pitrou/f4282f68a8dc9b11fe931bd0eeb1f8af) will probably work icw/ this PR. You do need to put the call to `_mm_crc32_u64` behind a macro otherwise it won't compile (even though you're not actually using that function).

jeroen commented on issue #3443: ARROW-4297: [C++] Fix build error with MinGW-w64 32-bit
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3443#issuecomment-457046597
 
 
   @pitrou your [patch](https://gist.github.com/pitrou/f4282f68a8dc9b11fe931bd0eeb1f8af) will probably work icw/ this PR. You do need to put the call to `_mm_crc32_u64` behind a macro as Kohei as done here, otherwise it will give an error `_mm_crc32_u64 undefined`, even if you're not actually using that function.

kou commented on issue #3693: ARROW-4297: [C++] Fix build error with MinGW-w64 32-bit
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3693#issuecomment-465031456
 
 
   #3657 has been merged.
   
   We will be able to build and run tests with the following change:
   
   ```diff
   diff --git a/ci/appveyor-cpp-build-mingw.bat b/ci/appveyor-cpp-build-mingw.bat
   index 4d399274..d70fce1a 100644
   --- a/ci/appveyor-cpp-build-mingw.bat
   +++ b/ci/appveyor-cpp-build-mingw.bat
   @@ -44,8 +44,10 @@ cmake ^
        -DARROW_PYTHON=ON ^
        -DPythonInterp_FIND_VERSION=ON ^
        -DPythonInterp_FIND_VERSION_MAJOR=3 ^
   +    -DARROW_BUILD_TESTS=ON ^
        .. || exit /B
    make -j4 || exit /B
   +make test || exit /B
    make install || exit /B
    popd
    
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

users@infra.apache.org
